data.title: Great food
data.text: Great food and service.  Been there several times so try different dishes each visit.  Try the fish and chips, hamburgers and shepard's pie.  All were excellent.

data.title: Can't beat the corned beef
data.text: I've eaten there four times and loved every meal. The corned beef was especially good. The hamburgers were wonderful.They also have a good selection of draft beer. The back room is set up for large groups, we have had meetings there.

data.title: Authentic Irish food
data.text: The food is good, but the seating is rustic and not very comfortable.  It is also very noisy as the walls are wood with some corrigated metal.  The folks in the bar can be loud and the sound travels.  Not great for conversation, but fun for a party.

data.title: HIDDEN GEM
data.text:
Visited this restaurant/ pub in June 2016 while on vacation .
What a great surprise !!!
Figure I'd see a good selection of my favourite beers on tap as , after all, it's an Irish pub.  
Well boy did I ever ......
Fantastic lineup of many of the best draft beers from around the world , perfectly chilled and Served by some real professionals that know what they are doing.
Now , here is the best part of our visit .....
The menu 
Fresh fish, hand cut fries, home made gravy , Everything made from scratch . Sure it takes a bit longer to get food this good brought to our table. One happy couple here . We came back 3 days in row !
Corned beef and cabbage the way grandma made it !
Fish and chips ( the real deal)
A $6 monster burger meal with a side , WOW

Live music , yes

THANK YOU SHINDIG for being a part of a great week in Port St Lucie ,Florida 

Mario and Lori

data.title: BOGO but Don't GO
data.text: My wife and I had 2 for 1 certificates and as we have never been to an Irish restaurant before we though we would give the Shindig a try, a mistake. When we arrived, about 6:15PM, although not at all crowded the noise was overbearing and we searched for a spot where we could talk to each other, didn't really find that spot but chose to stay anyway. My wife ordered the Fish and Chips which were delivered rather quickly and with a very generous portion of fried fish. The fish was somewhat greasy and overcooked, an okay dab of coleslaw and french fries that tasted rancid as if the cooking oil hadn't been changed for quite some time. Hers was a large plate of of not very well prepared food. My order on the other had was what I considered to be a small portion of terrible food. I had the shepards pie which was served in a medium sized bowl along with a piece of burned and soggy inedible toast. The pie itself was a mixture of about 2/3 mashed potatoes and 1/3 bland sauce/gravy with some lamb and vegetables, quite disappointing for the $15.00 menu price.  The only positive things I can mention is that the beer was cold and our waitress Lori was extremely nice and attentive and she was the only bright spot of the evening.

data.title: Irish Pub plus
data.text:
Located in a small shopping center it sits among other shops and restaurants. It's menu is distinctively Irish and the fish and chips are exceptionally good. The Irish playwrights decorate the walls but it is the pub fare you come for. Burgers and other basics are also on the menu
Service is friendly and no one will rush you   Prices are moderate

data.title: It really is an Irish Pub
data.text: Two rooms of pub atmosphere...I felt I was back in Ireland..... there was a single Irish singer the night we visited.... Enjoyed the fun atmosphere, and watching the Irish cheer watching a Notre Dame Football game on the TV...... We were sitting in the front room but had to move to the back room as the noise was too much for any conversation.....Bangors and mash were great and other Irish foods were on the menu....Also available were regular American foods.....

data.title: Nice atmosphere
data.text:
Visited this restaurant for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. It did not have many customers in it which is abnormal for the Florida winter seasonal snowbird season.

I really like the atmosphere and the ambience of the restaurant/ pub. Makes you feel almost like you're back in the old world. 

Two friends had the steak salad and both liked them very much. I had the fish and chips and they allowed me to substitute a side salad for the Cole slaw that normally comes with it. The side salad was fresh and had a nice variety of greens, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, etc. The fish was a single large piece of haddock which was cooked just right. It came on top of a bed of French fries. Another friend had the Belfast Burger and he liked it very much. We were all pleased with the food. 
The staff were very friendly, however the service was a bit slow. I believe this was due to not having many there on a Sunday early afternoon.
I definitely recommend trying this restaurant. It may not become a favorite, but the food is good, prices reasonable and the staff is friendly. Definitely worth checking it out!

data.title: MUST GO ON MONDAYS!!!
data.text: OK...where can you go to get a Burger and French fries and a side fro $6.00!!! well if you are in Fl....must go to Shing digs..We sat outside , very clean and great service but you must get there before 5pm. or you will have a long wait.

data.title: The leanest corned beef ever!
data.text: Located in a small shopping mall. Nicely decorated, clean establishment that really feels like a pub. Good selection of draft beers ($5 or so) and bottled beers. We got the corned beef and cabbage/mashed potato plates for about $15 apiece. Not a lot of food, but tasty. Thankfully, unlike many other restaurants, they did not serve the ubiquitous basket of cheap, white bread. Shindig was busy, but we received very good, attentive, and polite service from Amber. I'd go again.

data.title: Gone down hill
data.text: We have been going to Shindig for years for the great Irish music and good food.  Music is still good (when they have it- not often). Since owners change the food has gone south.  Dinner servings are less than a lunch portion.  They don't serve guests in groups at the same time.  Looks like they only want bar stool customers.  If you are Irish, find another place to go. We took guests there  and we are embarrassed.

user_location.name: Port Saint Lucie, Florida, United States

data.title: Cornbeef to die for.
data.text:
They have the best Cornbeef so good.  Shepperds pie excellent and there bread pudding is fantastic.  Love the sauces with food so good.  Cornbeef spring rolls are very good.
Down fall is beer is very expensive mostly craft beers need to get a good draft that is affordable with a meal.

data.title: The worst service I've ever experienced.
data.text: By The far the worst service ever experienced. There were 8 of us. 3 meals came out, they finished eating, 3 others came out, the finished eating, and then the last two..... Are you kidding me??? Go anywhere else. By far the worse experience of my life. Would not recommend.

data.title: Nice ambiance but food needs help
data.text: The bar is really cute and I love how it's decorated. My poor score is only a reflection of the food. Our waitress was also very nice.  I ordered the fish and chips. It was a generous portion haddock but it was sooooo greasy. The coleslaw that came with it was about 3 bites. The tartar sauce and fries were decent. My husband ordered the corn beef and cabbage. The corn beef was very dry, the cabbage was chopped and had bacon in it..... not something he expected. The mashed potatoes were plain and barely seasoned. They are marketed as champs but there were no scallions. I'm used to those Irish staple foods in Boston where there's such a strong Irish history. I so wanted to love this place but it just made me homesick.

data.title: Good Food - Excellent Service
data.text: Stopped in with another couple for dinner and drinks.  Harp beer was good & cold at only $2.75 each.  New England Clam Chowder was good but watery and full of potatoes at $5.99 a bowl.  I had the flat Iron steak which was good at $21.99.  All in all the food was  very good.  Our server, Amber W was absolutely excellent.  She was friendly, knowledgeable of their menu and professional.  She was everything you could ask for in a server.  It was an enjoyable evening.  I will be back.

data.title: Fun atmosphere, great waitress Kathy
data.text: We had a nice lunch at Shindig. Kathy was attentive, cheerful  and upbeat. The all you can eat fish and chips were really good. I enjoyed the skinny fries. They have a nice variety on the menu including Irish fare and sandwiches and salads. Nice local place.

data.title: Awesome Bread Pudding
data.text: Favorite place for the bread pudding, fish and chips and, without a doubt, the best cream of mushroom soup I've ever had.  Nice and quiet at lunch but can get very noisy when the bands play in the evening.

data.title: Awesome food cute set up.
data.text: I've been there 3 times and get the bangers and mash potatoes. My daughter dreaded going didn't think she'd like it. She ended up with the flatbread steak ( I believe that was what it was called ) my husband has had the ruben and fish n chips. I give it 👍🏻👍🏻. Went to bring mom there but ended up somewhere else which was not good. Promised next time going back to Shindig!

data.title: Second time same old
data.text: Visited for the second time but a year apart.  This time had the fish n chips. While the chips were ok the fish was like fish ball.  Pieces of fish mashed together in a batter, couldn't get a whole piece on my fork.  Terrible

data.title: Great!!!
data.text: All the flavors I hoped for. Crispy and full of flavor fish and chips --and Shepherds lamb pie, We'll be back!
